FuncDef:
The ip topology enable command binds an interface to a specified IPv4 topology.
The undo ip topology enable command unbinds an interface from a specified IPv4 topology.
By default, an interface is bound to an IPv4 base topology.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an IPv4 topology.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable an interface to generate a direct route in a specified IPv4 topology, run the ip topology enable command to bind the interface to the IPv4 topology.
Prerequisites
The topology has been created.
Configuration Impact
After the ip topology command is run, the interface generates a direct route in the specified IPv4 topology.
Precautions
An interface is bound to the base topology by default, and the interface cannot be unbound from or re-bound to the base topology.
